definitions.definition: unable to find your way; not knowing where you are

examples.text: We always **get lost** in London.
We're **completely lost**.
We got lost in the woods.
I was tired, hungry and hopelessly lost.

definitions.definition: that cannot be found or brought back

examples.text: I'm still looking for that lost file.
a lost cat/dog/pet
Your invitation must have **got lost** in the post.
Report all instances of **lost or stolen** cards immediately.
Along with flight delays, lost luggage is the most common cause for passenger complaint.
Without a form of backup, this data would be **lost forever**.

definitions.definition: that cannot be obtained; that cannot be found or created again

examples.text: Piracy is costing film studios millions in **lost revenues**.
The strike cost them thousands of pounds in **lost business**.
lost sales/profits/earnings
She's trying to recapture her **lost youth**.
a poignant and bittersweet tale of lost love
He regretted the **lost** *(= wasted)* **opportunity** to apologize to her.
the lost art of letter-writing

definitions.definition: unable to deal successfully with a particular situation

examples.text: I **felt** so **lost** after my mother died.
We would be lost without your help.
He's a **lost soul** *(= a person who does not seem to know what to do, and seems unhappy)*.
I felt lost without my phone.
She looked rather lost and lonely, standing in a corner by herself.

definitions.definition: unable to understand something because it is too complicated

examples.text: They spoke so quickly I just got lost.
Hang on a minute—I'm lost.
I was a little lost at first but quickly caught on to what was happening in this elaborate series.

definitions.definition: there is still some hope of making a bad situation better

examples.text: All is not lost—we still haven’t tried the banks for a loan.

definitions.definition: to be so surprised, confused, etc. that you do not know what to say
to be giving all your attention to something so that you do not notice what is happening around you

examples.text: to be lost in thought

definitions.definition: to be not understood or noticed by somebody

examples.text: His jokes were completely lost on most of the students.

definitions.definition: to be giving all your attention to something so that you do not notice what is happening around you

examples.text: When he’s listening to music he’s lost to the world.

definitions.definition: a rude way of telling somebody to go away, or of refusing something

examples.text: Tell him to get lost.
‘Lend us the car, won’t you?’ ‘Get lost!’

definitions.definition: to stop expecting to find somebody alive
to do something quickly or very often because you wish you had started doing it sooner

examples.text: I’ll have to work hard now to make up for lost time.

definitions.definition: they do not like each other

examples.text: There's no love lost between her and her in-laws.
